s.text: Many apartheid-era blacks claimed mixed ancestry in order to avoid more severe restrictions, often changing family names and falsifying birth records.
Today's Papers wonders if an inner-city high school might prove a more effective model.
The WP takes a look at exploited immigrant high tech workers on its front.
Cynics cite the opportune timing of coloreds' rediscovered blackness now that the black-majority government has instituted policies helping those who faired worst under apartheid.
The NYT does not explain why millions of dollars were needed to track two men later described as easy to find.
